p: CHIKV is a mosquito-borne virus that belongs to the Alphavirus genus, which encompasses mainly arboviruses, and is believed to have a marine origin [ 4, 5]. The presence of CHIKV in sylvatic mosquitoes, such as Aedes africanus, Aedes furcifer, and A. taylori, and non-human primates in Uganda and Tanzania suggests that the virus originated in Central or East Africa [ 6, 7].
